text: <@U7SL518D6> - alright thanks for the response, I really appreciate it. Is there a chance it will be public, We're making a CRM extender that will call an app via Iframe, and we want the client to have same feel as HubSpot or somehow make it feel its part of HubSpot. any work around to easily implement your design. BTW we're using react for this.
copying a single component from developers tool will be a tons of work. I wonder if we can have even just the SCSS file for the components that would be nice. :slightly_smiling_face:

Just guessing, haven't looked at your page.  You likely need to remove jQuery all together or update to a new version see:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates#jquery|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates#jquery>
I will read this, thank you very much

2 things I noticed-
• the CSS used in the site is unminified, and so pretty easy to "borrow" from: <https://static.hsappstatic.net/ui-library-public/static-1.91/bundles/project_with_deps.css>
• the site's apparently running in dev mode, so if you have React Devtools installed, you can really drill into what's going on
Thanks for noticing this <@U016Z4ERNTX>, I'll have it a try later.
